question: A train, 110 m long, is running at a speed of 60 km/hr. How many seconds does it take to cross another train, 170 m long, standing on parallel track ?
explanation:
$latex Speed\\ of\\ train = \\frac{Sum\\ of\\ length\\ of\\ both\\ trains}{Time\\ Taken}&s=1$
$latex => \\frac{60\\times 5}{18} = \\frac{110+170}{t} = \\frac{280}{t}&s=1$
$latex => t = \\frac{280\\times 18}{60\\times 5} = 16.8\\ seconds&s=1$
Hence option [B] is correct answer.
